Reading through these comments, I see a remarkable socio-cultural clash theme emerging between the US and... the Dutch! The US — a land where anyone from the upper population levels can buy a house (at random, anywhere, with minimal fuss) — is trying to figure out how to cope with one extended family. The Dutch, meanwhile, accept this as standard and develop a kind of self-organizing 'mesoleil' around it.

River Queen attempts to pack a complicated, sweeping, historical narrative into just under two hours. The movie even feels short and unbalanced at the front to portend the greater narrative flaws of the middle and back half of the movie.

Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is going to be criticized by some because it has very little action in it (but it does have some major and cool action scenes). On the other hand, there is a lot of comedy in this film, a lot of fun and several jokey moments (nod to Jackie Chan).
